advanced_moves_1.description: When you heal with Arcane Art you heal +1d8 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Healing Song

advanced_moves_1.description: When you **grant bonus damage with Arcane Art**, you grant an extra +1d4 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Vicious Cacophony

advanced_moves_1.description:
When you unleash a crazed performance (a righteous lute solo or mighy brass blast, maybe) choose a target who can hear you and roll+CHA. 

 * On a 10+ the target attacks their nearest ally in range. 
 * On a 7-9 they attack their nearest ally, but you also draw their attention and ire.
advanced_moves_1.name: It Goes To Eleven

advanced_moves_1.description:
When you shout with great force or play a shattering note choose a target and roll+CON. 

 * On a 10+ the target takes 1d10 damage and is deafened for a few minutes. 
 * On a 7-9 you still damage your target, but it’s out of control: the GM will choose an additional target nearby.
advanced_moves_1.name: Metal Hurlant

advanced_moves_1.description: When you successfully aid someone you take +1 forward as well.
advanced_moves_1.name: A Little Help From My Friends

advanced_moves_1.description: Your Arcane Art is strong, allowing you to choose two effects instead of one.
advanced_moves_1.name: Eldritch Tome

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Hack & Slash, you take +1 armor forward.
advanced_moves_1.name: Duelist's Parry

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Parley with someone, on a 7+ you also take +1 forward with them.
advanced_moves_1.name: Bamboozle

advanced_moves_1.description: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
advanced_moves_1.name: Multiclass Dabbler

advanced_moves_1.description: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
advanced_moves_1.name: Multiclass Initiate

advanced_moves_2.description: When you heal with Arcane Art, you heal +2d8 damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Healing Chorus

advanced_moves_2.description: When you **grant bonus damage with Arcane Art**, you grant an extra +2d4 damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Vicious Blast

advanced_moves_2.description: When you **meet someone you’ve met before** (your call) after some time apart you take +1 forward against them.
advanced_moves_2.name: Unforgettable Face

advanced_moves_2.description:
When you **first meet someone who’s heard songs about you**, roll+CHA.

 * On a 10+, tell the GM two things they’ve heard about you.
 * On a 7-9, tell the GM one thing they’ve heard, and the GM tells you one thing.
advanced_moves_2.name: Reputation

advanced_moves_2.description: When you use Arcane Art, you choose two effects. You also get to choose one of those effects to double.
advanced_moves_2.name: Eldritch Chord

advanced_moves_2.description: When you hear an enemy cast a spell the GM will tell you the name of the spell and its effects. Take +1 forward when acting on the answers.
advanced_moves_2.name: An Ear For Magic

advanced_moves_2.description: When you use **Charming and Open** you may also ask “How are you vulnerable to me?” Your subject may not ask this question of you.
advanced_moves_2.name: Devious

advanced_moves_2.description: When you **Hack & Slash**, you take +2 armor forward.
advanced_moves_2.name: Duelists's Block

advanced_moves_2.description: Get a move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
advanced_moves_2.name: Multiclass Master

chaotic.description: Spur others to significant and unplanned decisive action.
chaotic.name: Chaotic

good.description: Perform your art to aid someone else.
good.name: Good

neutral.description: Avoid a conflict or defuse a tense situation.
neutral.name: Neutral

alignments_list.description: Perform your art to aid someone else.
alignments_list.name: Good

alignments_list.description: Avoid a conflict or defuse a tense situation.
alignments_list.name: Neutral

alignments_list.description: Spur others to significant and unplanned decisive action.
alignments_list.name: Chaotic

bonds: This is not my first adventure with __________.
I sang stories of __________ long before I ever met them in person.
__________ is often the butt of my jokes.
I am writing a ballad about the adventures of __________.
__________ trusted me with a secret.
__________ does not trust me, and for good reason.
description:
The poems say an adventurer’s life is all open roads and the glory of coin and combat. The tales told in every farmhand-filled inn have to have some ring of truth to them, don’t they? The songs to inspire peasantry and royals alike—to soothe the savage beast or drive men to a frenzy—have to come from somewhere.

Enter the bard. You, with your smooth tongue and quick wit. You teller-of-tales and singer-of-songs. It takes a mere minstrel to retell a thing but a true bard to live it. Strap on your boots, noble orator. Sharpen that hidden dagger and take up the call. Someone’s got to be there, fighting shoulder-to-shoulder with the goons and the thugs and the soon-to-be-heroes. Who better than you to write the tale of your own heroism?

Nobody. Get going.

gear_choices.label: Choose one instrument, all are 0 weight for you
list: A fine lute, a gift from a noble
The pipes with which you courted your first love
A songbook in a forgotten tongue

gear_choices.label: Choose your clothing
list: Leather Armor (1 armor, worn, 10 coins, 1 weight)

gear_choices.label: Choose your armament
list: Dueling Rapier (close, 1 piercing, Precise, 50 coins, 2 weight)
Ragged Bow (near, 15 coins, 2 weight), Bundle of Arrows (3 ammo, 1 coins, 1 weight), and Short Sword (close, 8 coins, 1 weight)

name: Bard

race_moves.description: When you enter an important location (your call) you can ask the GM for one fact from the history of that location.
race_moves.name: Elf

race_moves.description: When you first enter a civilized settlement someone who respects the custom of hospitality to minstrels will take you in as their guest.
race_moves.name: Human

starting_gear: You have Dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight)

starting_moves.description:
When you **weave a performance into a basic spell**, choose an ally and an effect:

 - Heal 1d8 damage
 - +1d4 forward to damage
 - Their mind is shaken clear of one enchantment
 - The next time someone successfully assists the target with aid, they get +2 instead of +1

Then roll+Cha.

 - On a 10+, the ally gets the selected effect.
 - On a 7-9, your spell still works, but you draw unwanted attention or your magic reverberates to other targets affecting them as well, GM’s choice
starting_moves.name: Arcane Art

starting_moves.description:
Choose an area of expertise:

 - Spells and Magicks
 - The Dead and Undead
 - Grand Histories of the Known World
 - A Bestiary of Creatures Unusual
 - The Planar Spheres
 - Legends of Heroes Past
 - Gods and Their Servants

When you **first encounter an important creature, location, or item (your call) covered by your bardic lore** you can ask the GM any one question about it; the GM will answer truthfully. The GM may then ask you what tale, song, or legend you heard that information in.
starting_moves.name: Bardic Lore

starting_moves.description:
When you **speak frankly with someone**, you can ask their player a question from the list below. They must answer it truthfully, then they may ask you a question from the list (which you must answer truthfully).

 - Whom do you serve?
 - What do you wish I would do?
 - How can I get you to __________?
 - What are you really feeling right now?
 - What do you most desire?
starting_moves.name: Charming and Open

starting_moves.description: When you return to a civilized settlement you’ve visited before, tell the GM when you were last here. They’ll tell you how it’s changed since then.
starting_moves.name: A Port in the Storm

advanced_moves_1.description: Choose one spell. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.
advanced_moves_1.name: Chosen One

advanced_moves_1.description: When you heal someone they take +2 forward to their damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Invigorate

advanced_moves_1.description: When someone takes their last breath in your presence, they take +1 to the roll.
advanced_moves_1.name: The Scales of Life and Death

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Cast a Spell you ignore the first -1 penalty from ongoing spells.
advanced_moves_1.name: Serenity

advanced_moves_1.description: Cure Light Wounds is a rote for you, and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells.
advanced_moves_1.name: First Aid

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Commune you get 1 hold and lose any hold you already had. Spend that hold when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, they intervene with an appropriate manifestation (a sudden gust of wind, a lucky slip, a burst of light) and negate the damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Divine Intervention

advanced_moves_1.description: When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +1d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, take +1 forward to cast a spell.
advanced_moves_1.name: Penitent

advanced_moves_1.description:
When you Cast a Spell, on a 10+ you have the option of choosing from the 7–9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well:

 - The spell’s effects are doubled
 - The spell’s targets are doubled
advanced_moves_1.name: Empower

advanced_moves_1.description: When you sacrifice something of value to your deity and pray for guidance, your deity tells you what it would have you do. If you do it, mark experience.
advanced_moves_1.name: Orison for Guidance

advanced_moves_1.description: You get +2 armor while on a quest.
advanced_moves_1.name: Divine Protection

advanced_moves_1.description: When you heal someone else of damage, add your level to the amount of damage healed.
advanced_moves_1.name: Devoted Healer

advanced_moves_2.description: Choose one spell in addition to the one you picked for chosen one. You are granted that spell as if it was one level lower.
advanced_moves_2.name: Anointed

advanced_moves_2.description: The first time you spend time in prayer as appropriate to your god after taking this move, choose a feature associated with your deity (rending claws, wings of sapphire feathers, an all-seeing third eye, etc.). When you emerge from prayer, you permanently gain that physical feature.
advanced_moves_2.name: Apotheosis

advanced_moves_2.description: When you take time after a conflict to dedicate your victory to your deity and deal with the dead, take +1 forward.
advanced_moves_2.name: Reaper

advanced_moves_2.description: You ignore the -1 penalty from two spells you maintain.
advanced_moves_2.name: Providence

advanced_moves_2.description: Cure Moderate Wounds is a rote for you, and therefore doesn’t count against your limit of granted spells.
advanced_moves_2.name: Greater First Aid

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Commune you gain 2 hold and lose any hold you already had. Spend that hold when you or an ally takes damage to call on your deity, who intervenes with an appropriate manifestation (a sudden gust of wind, a lucky slip, a burst of light) and negates the damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Divine Invincibility

advanced_moves_2.description: When you take damage and embrace the pain, you may take +1d4 damage (ignoring armor). If you do, take +1 forward to cast a spell and add your level to any damage done or healed by the spell.
advanced_moves_2.name: Martyr

advanced_moves_2.description: When you wear no armor or shield you get 3 armor.
advanced_moves_2.name: Divine Armor

advanced_moves_2.description:
When you cast a spell, on a 10–11 you have the option of choosing from the 7–9 list. If you do, you may choose one of these effects as well. On a 12+ you get to choose one of these effects for free.

 - The spell’s effects are doubled
 - The spell’s targets are doubled
advanced_moves_2.name: Greater Empower

advanced_moves_2.description: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
advanced_moves_2.name: Multiclass Dabbler

evil.description: Harm another to prove the superiority of your church or god.
evil.name: Evil

lawful.description: Endanger yourself following the precepts of your church or god.
lawful.name: Lawful

alignments_list.description: Endanger yourself to heal another.
alignments_list.name: Good

alignments_list.description: Endanger yourself following the precepts of your church or god.
alignments_list.name: Lawful

alignments_list.description: Harm another to prove the superiority of your church or god.
alignments_list.name: Evil

bonds: __________ has insulted my deity; I do not trust them.
__________ is a good and faithful person; I trust them implicitly.
__________ is in constant danger, I will keep them safe.
I am working on converting __________ to my faith.
description:
The lands of Dungeon World are a gods-forsaken mess. They’re lousy with the walking dead, beasts of all sorts, and the vast unnatural spaces between safe and temple-blessed civilizations. It is a godless world out there. That’s why it needs you.

Bringing the glory of your god to the heathens isn’t just in your nature—it’s your calling. It falls to you to proselytize with sword and mace and spell. To cleave deep into the witless heart of the wilds and plant the seed of divinity there. Some say that it is best to keep god close to your heart. You know that’s rubbish. God lives at the edge of a blade.

Show the world who is lord.

gear_choices.label: Choose your armament
list: Staff (close, two-handed, 1 coins, 1 weight) and Bandages (3 uses, slow, 5 coins, 0 weight)

gear_choices.label: Choose one
list: Adventuring Gear (5 uses, 20 coins, 1 weight) and dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight)

name: Cleric

race_moves.description: You are one with stone. When you Commune you are also granted a special version of Words of the Unspeaking as a rote which only works on stone.
race_moves.name: Dwarf

race_moves.description: Your faith is diverse. Choose one wizard spell. You can cast and be granted that spell as if it was a cleric spell.
race_moves.name: Human

animate_dead.description:
You invoke a hungry spirit to possess a recently-dead body and serve you. This creates a zombie that follows your orders to the best of its limited abilities. Treat the zombie as a character, but with access to only the basic moves. It has a +1 modifier for all stats and 1 HP. The zombie also gets your choice of 1d4 of these traits:

 - It’s talented. Give one stat a +2 modifier.
 - It’s durable. It has +2 HP for each level you have.
 - It has a functioning brain and can complete complex tasks.
 - It does not appear obviously dead, at least for a day or two.
The zombie lasts until it is destroyed by taking damage in excess of its HP, or until you end the spell. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
animate_dead.name: Animate Dead

bless.description: Your deity smiles upon a combatant of your choice. They take +1 ongoing so long as battle continues and they stand and fight. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
bless.name: Bless

cause_fear.description: Choose a target you can see and a nearby object. The target is afraid of the object so long as you maintain the spell. Their reaction is up to them: flee, panic, beg, fight. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell. You cannot target entities with less than animal intelligence (magical constructs, undead, automatons, and the like).
cause_fear.name: Cause Fear

consume_unlife.description: The mindless undead creature you touch is destroyed and you steal its death energy to heal yourself or the next ally you touch. The amount of damage healed is equal to the HP that the creature had remaining before you destroyed it.
consume_unlife.name: Consume Unlife

contagion.description: Choose a creature you can see. Until you end this spell, the target suffers from a disease of your choice. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
contagion.name: Contagion

control_weather.description: Pray for rain—or sun, wind, or snow. Within a day or so, your god will answer. The weather will change according to your will and last a handful of days.
control_weather.name: Control Weather

cure_critical_wounds.description: Heal an ally you touch of 3d8 damage.
cure_critical_wounds.name: Cure Critical Wounds

cure_light_wounds.description: At your touch wounds scab and bones cease to ache. Heal an ally you touch of 1d8 damage.
cure_light_wounds.name: Cure Light Wounds

cure_moderate_wounds.description: You staunch bleeding and set bones through magic. Heal an ally you touch of 2d8 damage.
cure_moderate_wounds.name: Cure Moderate Wounds

darkness.description: Choose an area you can see: it’s filled with supernatural darkness and shadow. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
darkness.name: Darkness

detect_alignment.description: When you cast this spell choose an alignment: Good, Evil, Lawful, or Chaotic. One of your senses is briefly able to detect that alignment. The GM will tell you what here is of that alignment.
detect_alignment.name: Detect Alignment

divination.description: Name a person, place, or thing you want to learn about. Your deity grants you visions of the target, as clear as if you were there.
divination.name: Divination

divine_presence.description: Every creature must ask your leave to enter your presence, and you must give permission aloud for them to enter. Any creature without your leave takes an extra 1d10 damage whenever they take damage in your presence. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
divine_presence.name: Divine Presence

guidance.description: The symbol of your deity appears before you and gestures towards the direction or course of action your deity would have you take then disappears. The message is through gesture only; your communication through this spell is severely limited.
guidance.name: Guidance

harm.description: Touch an enemy and strike them with divine wrath—deal 2d8 damage to them and 1d6 damage to yourself. This damage ignores armor.
harm.name: Harm

heal.description: Touch an ally and you may heal their damage a number of points up to your maximum HP.
heal.name: Heal

hold_person.description: Choose a person you can see. Until you cast a spell or leave their presence they cannot act except to speak. This effect ends immediately if the target takes damage from any source.
hold_person.name: Hold Person

light.description: An item you touch glows with divine light, about as bright as a torch. It gives off no heat or sound and requires no fuel but is otherwise like a mundane torch. You have complete control of the color of the flame. The spell lasts as long as it is in your presence.
light.name: Light

magic_weapon.description: The weapon you hold while casting does +1d4 damage until you dismiss this spell. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
magic_weapon.name: Magic Weapon

mark_of_death.description: Choose a creature whose true name you know. This spell creates permanent runes on a target surface that will kill that creature, should they read them.
mark_of_death.name: Mark of Death

plague.description: Name a city, town, encampment, or other place where people live. As long as this spell is active that place is beset by a plague appropriate to your deity’s domains (locusts, death of the first born, etc.) While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
plague.name: Plague

repair.description: Choose one event in the target’s past. All effects of that event, including damage, poison, disease, and magical effects, are ended and repaired. HP and diseases are healed, poisons are neutralized, magical effects are ended.
repair.name: Repair

resurrection.description:
Tell the GM you would like to resurrect a corpse whose soul has not yet fully departed this world. Resurrection is always possible, but the GM will give you one or more (possibly all) of these conditions to fulfill:

 - It’s going to take days/weeks/months
 - You must get help from ____
 - It will require a lot of money
 - You must sacrifice ____ to do it
The GM may, depending on the circumstances, allow you to resurrect the corpse now, with the understanding that the conditions must be met before it’s permanent, or require you to meet the conditions before the corpse is resurrected.
resurrection.name: Resurrection

revelation.description: Your deity answers your prayers with a moment of perfect understanding. The GM will shed light on the current situation. When acting on the information, you take +1 forward.
revelation.name: Revelation

sanctify.description: Food or water you hold in your hands while you cast this spell is consecrated by your deity. In addition to now being holy or unholy, the affected substance is purified of any mundane spoilage.
sanctify.name: Sanctify

sanctuary.description: As you cast this spell, you walk the perimeter of an area, consecrating it to your deity. As long as you stay within that area you are alerted whenever someone acts with malice within the sanctuary (including entering with harmful intent). Anyone who receives healing within a sanctuary heals +1d4 HP.
sanctuary.name: Sanctuary

sever.description: Choose an appendage on the target such as an arm, tentacle, or wing. The appendage is magically severed from their body, causing no damage but considerable pain. Missing an appendage may, for example, keep a winged creature from flying, or a bull from goring you on its horns. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
sever.name: Sever

speak_with_dead.description: A corpse converses with you briefly. It will answer any three questions you pose to it to the best of the knowledge it had in life and the knowledge it gained in death.
speak_with_dead.name: Speak With Dead

storm_of_vengeance.description: Your deity brings the unnatural weather of your choice to pass. Rain of blood or acid, clouds of souls, wind that can carry away buildings, or any other weather you can imagine: ask and it shall come.
storm_of_vengeance.name: Storm of Vengeance

trap_soul.description: You trap the soul of a dying creature within a gem. The trapped creature is aware of its imprisonment but can still be manipulated through spells, parley, and other effects. All moves against the trapped creature are at +1. You can free the soul at any time but it can never be recaptured once freed.
trap_soul.name: Trap Soul

true_seeing.description: Your vision is opened to the true nature of everything you lay your eyes on. You pierce illusions and see things that have been hidden. The GM will describe the area before you ignoring any illusions and falsehoods, magical or otherwise. While this spell is ongoing you take -1 to cast a spell.
true_seeing.name: True Seeing

word_of_recall.description: Choose a word. The first time after casting this spell that you speak the chosen word, you and any allies touching you when you cast the spell are immediately returned to the exact spot where you cast the spell. You can only maintain a single location; casting Word of Recall again before speaking the word replaces the earlier spell.
word_of_recall.name: Word of Recall

words_of_the_unspeaking.description: With a touch you speak to the spirits within things. The non-living object you touch answers three questions you pose, as best it can.
words_of_the_unspeaking.name: Words of the Unspeaking

starting_gear: You carry dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight) and some symbol of the divine, describe it (0 weight)

starting_moves.description:
You serve and worship some deity or power which grants you spells. Give your god a name (maybe Helferth, Sucellus, Zorica or Krugon the Bleak) and choose your deity’s domain:

 - Healing and Restoration
 - Bloody Conquest
 - Civilization
 - Knowledge and Hidden Things
 - The Downtrodden and Forgotten
 - What Lies Beneath
Choose one precept of your religion:

 - Your religion preaches the sanctity of suffering, add Petition: Suffering
 - Your religion is cultish and insular, add Petition: Gaining Secrets
 - Your religion has important sacrificial rites, add Petition: Offering
 - Your religion believes in trial by combat, add Petition: Personal Victory
starting_moves.name: Deity

starting_moves.description: When you petition your deity according to the precept of your religion, you are granted some useful knowledge or boon related to your deity’s domain. The GM will tell you what.
starting_moves.name: Divine Guidance

starting_moves.description: When you hold your holy symbol aloft and call on your deity for protection, roll+Wis. On a 7+, so long as you continue to pray and brandish your holy symbol, no undead may come within reach of you. On a 10+, you also momentarily daze intelligent undead and cause mindless undead to flee. Aggression breaks the effects and they are able to act as normal. Intelligent undead may still find ways to harry you from afar. They’re clever like that.
starting_moves.name: Turn Undead

starting_moves.description:
When you spend uninterrupted time (an hour or so) in quiet communion with your deity, you:

 - Lose any spells already granted to you.
 - Are granted new spells of your choice whose total levels don’t exceed your own level+1, and none of which is a higher level than your own level.
 - Prepare all of your rotes, which never count against your limit.
starting_moves.name: Commune

starting_moves.description:
When you unleash a spell granted to you by your deity, roll+Wis. On a 10+, the spell is successfully cast and your deity does not revoke the spell, so you may cast it again. On a 7–9, the spell is cast, but choose one:

 - You draw unwelcome attention or put yourself in a spot. The GM will tell you how.
 - Your casting distances you from your deity—take -1 ongoing to cast a spell until the next time you commune.
 - After you cast it, the spell is revoked by your deity. You cannot cast the spell again until you commune and have it granted to you.
Note that maintaining spells with ongoing effects will sometimes cause a penalty to your roll to cast a spell.
starting_moves.name: Cast a Spell

advanced_moves_1.description: Choose one move from the ranger class list.
advanced_moves_1.name: Hunter’s Brother

advanced_moves_1.description: When you are in an appropriate animal form (something dangerous) increase your damage to d8.
advanced_moves_1.name: Red of Tooth and Claw

advanced_moves_1.description: When you spend time in a place, making note of its resident spirits and calling on the spirits of the land, roll+Wis. You will be granted a vision of significance to you, your allies, and the spirits around you. On a 10+ the vision will be clear and helpful to you. On a 7–9 the vision is unclear, its meaning murky. On a miss, the vision is upsetting, frightening, or traumatizing. The GM will describe it. Take -1 forward.
advanced_moves_1.name: Communion of Whispers

advanced_moves_1.description: So long as your feet touch the ground you have +1 armor.
advanced_moves_1.name: Barkskin

advanced_moves_1.description: When you mark an animal (with mud, dirt, or blood) you can see through that animal’s eyes as if they were your own, no matter what distance separates you. Only one animal at a time may be marked in this way.
advanced_moves_1.name: Eyes of the Tiger

advanced_moves_1.description: When you take damage while shapeshifted you may choose to revert to your natural form to negate the damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Shed

advanced_moves_1.description: You see the spirits in the sand, the sea and the stone. You may now apply your spirit tongue, shapeshifting and studied essence to inanimate natural objects (plants and rocks) or creatures made thereof, as well as animals. Thing-talker forms can be exact copies or can be mobile vaguely humanoid-shaped entities.
advanced_moves_1.name: Thing-Talker

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Shapeshifter choose a stat: you take +1 ongoing to rolls using that stat while shifted. The GM will choose a stat, too: you take -1 ongoing to rolls using that stat while shifted.
advanced_moves_1.name: Formcrafter

advanced_moves_1.description:
When you call on the primal spirits of fire, water, earth or air to perform a task for you roll+Wis. On a 10+ choose two. On a 7–9 choose one. On a miss, some catastrophe occurs as a result of your calling.

 - The effect you desire comes to pass
 - You avoid paying nature’s price 
 - You retain control
advanced_moves_1.name: Elemental Mastery

advanced_moves_1.description: When you deal damage, take 1 balance. When you touch someone and channel the spirits of life you may spend balance. For each balance spent, heal 1d4 HP.
advanced_moves_1.name: Balance

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Shapeshifter, roll 1d4 and add that total to your hold.
advanced_moves_2.name: Embracing No Form

advanced_moves_2.description: You are able to study the essence of specific individuals to take their exact form, including men, elves, or the like. Suppressing your tell is possible, but if you do, take -1 ongoing until you return to your own form.
advanced_moves_2.name: Doppelgänger’s Dance

advanced_moves_2.description: When you are in an appropriate animal form (something dangerous) increase your damage to d10.
advanced_moves_2.name: Blood and Thunder

advanced_moves_2.description: When you take this move, the next opportunity that you have safety and time to spend in an appropriate location, you may attune yourself to a new land. This effect occurs only once and the GM will tell you how long it will take and what cost you must pay. From then on, you are considered to be born of the soil in both lands.
advanced_moves_2.name: The Druid Sleep

advanced_moves_2.description: You see the patterns that make up the fabric of the world. You may now apply your spirit tongue, shapeshifter and studied essence moves to pure elements—fire, water, air and earth.
advanced_moves_2.name: World-Talker

advanced_moves_2.description: Choose one move from the ranger class list.
advanced_moves_2.name: Stalker’s Sister

advanced_moves_2.description: You may increase your armor by 1 or deal an additional +1d4 damage while in an animal form. Choose which when you Shapeshifter.
advanced_moves_2.name: Formshaper

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Shapeshifter, you may create a merged form of up to three different shapes. You may be a bear with the wings of an eagle and the head of a ram, for example. Each feature will grant you a different move to make. Your chimera form follows the same rules as shapeshifter otherwise.
advanced_moves_2.name: Chimera

advanced_moves_2.description: When you are under open skies when the sun rises the GM will ask you what the weather will be that day. Tell them whatever you like, it comes to pass.
advanced_moves_2.name: Weather Weaver

alignments_list.description: Destroy a symbol of civilization.
alignments_list.name: Chaotic

alignments_list.description: Help something or someone grow.
alignments_list.name: Good

alignments_list.description: Eliminate an unnatural menace.
alignments_list.name: Neutral

bonds: __________ smells more like prey than a hunter.
The spirits spoke to me of a great danger that follows __________.
I have showed __________ a secret rite of the Land.
__________ has tasted my blood and I theirs. We are bound by it.
description:
Cast your eyes around the fire. What has brought you to these people, stinking of the dust and sweat of the city? Perhaps it is a kindness—do you protect them as the mother bear watches over her cubs? Are they your pack, now? Strange brothers and sisters you have. Whatever your inspiration, they would certainly fail without your sharp senses and sharper claws.

You are of the sacred spaces; you are born of soil and wear the marks of her spirits on your skin. You may have had a life before, maybe you were a city dweller like them, but not now. You’ve given up that static shape. Listen to your allies pray to their carved stone gods and polish their silver shells. They speak of the glory they’ll find back in that festering town you left behind.

Their gods are children, their steel is false protection. You walk the old ways, you wear the pelts of the earth itself. You’ll take your share of the treasure, but will you ever walk as one of them? Only time will tell.

gear_choices.label: Choose one:
list: Poultices and Herbs (2 uses, slow, 10 coins, 1 weight)

name: Druid

race_moves.description: The sap of the elder trees flows within you. In addition to any other attunements, the Great Forest is always considered your land.
race_moves.name: Elf

race_moves.description: As your people learned to bind animals to field and farm, so too are you bound to them. You may always take the shape of any domesticated animal, in addition to your normal options.
race_moves.name: Human

race_moves.description: You sing the healing songs of spring and brook. When you Make Camp, you and your allies heal +1d6.
race_moves.name: Halfling

starting_gear: You carry some token of your land, describe it.

starting_moves.description:
You learned your magic in a place whose spirits are strong and ancient and they’ve marked you as one of their own. No matter where you go, they live within you and allow you to take their shape. Choose one of the following. It is the land to which you are attuned—when shapeshifting you may take the shape of any animal who might live in your Land.

 - The Great Forests
 - The Whispering Plains
 - The Vast Desert
 - The Stinking Mire
 - The River Delta
 - The Depths of the Earth
 - The Sapphire Islands
 - The Open Sea
 - The Towering Mountains
 - The Frozen North
 - The Blasted Wasteland
Chose a tell—a physical attribute that marks you as born of the soil—that reflects the spirit of your land. It may be an animal feature like antlers or leopard’s spots or something more general: hair like leaves or eyes of glittering crystal. Your tell remains no matter what shape you take.
starting_moves.name: Born of the Soil

starting_moves.description: You don’t need to eat or drink. If a move tells you to mark off a ration just ignore it.
starting_moves.name: By Nature Sustained

starting_moves.description: The grunts, barks, chirps, and calls of the creatures of the wild are as language to you. You can understand any animal native to your land or akin to one whose essence you have studied.
starting_moves.name: Spirit Tongue

starting_moves.description:
When you call upon the spirits to change your shape, roll+Wis. On a 10+ hold 3. On a 7–9 hold 2. On a miss hold 1 in addition to whatever the GM says.
You may take on the physical form of any species whose essence you have studied or who lives in your land: you and your possessions meld into a perfect copy of the species’ form. You have any innate abilities and weaknesses of the form: claws, wings, gills, breathing water instead of air. You still use your normal stats but some moves may be harder to trigger—a housecat will find it hard to do battle with an ogre. The GM will also tell you one or more moves associated with your new form. Spend 1 hold to make that move. Once you’re out of hold, you return to your natural form. At any time, you may spend all your hold and revert to your natural form.
starting_moves.name: Shapeshifter

starting_moves.description: When you spend time in contemplation of an animal spirit, you may add its species to those you can assume using shapeshifting.
starting_moves.name: Studied Essence

advanced_moves_1.description: When you deal damage, deal +1d4 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Merciless

advanced_moves_1.description: When you consult the spirits that reside within your signature weapon, they will give you an insight relating to the current situation, and might ask you some questions in return, roll+CHA. On a 10+, the GM will give you good detail. On a 7-9, the GM will give you an impression.
advanced_moves_1.name: Heirloom

advanced_moves_1.description: When you make your armor take the brunt of damage dealt to you, the damage is negated but you must reduce the armor value of your armor or shield (your choice) by 1. The value is reduced each time you make this choice. If the reduction leaves the item with 0 armor it is destroyed.
advanced_moves_1.name: Armor Mastery

advanced_moves_1.description: Choose one extra enhancement for your signature weapon.
advanced_moves_1.name: Improved Weapon

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Discern Realities during combat, you take +1.
advanced_moves_1.name: Seeing Red

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Parley using threats of impending violence as leverage, you may use STR instead of CHA.
advanced_moves_1.name: Interrogator

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Hack & Slash an enemy, your next attack against that same foe deals +1d4 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Scent of Blood

advanced_moves_1.description: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
advanced_moves_1.name: Multiclass Dabbler

advanced_moves_1.description: You gain +1 armor.
advanced_moves_1.name: Iron Hide

advanced_moves_1.description: When you have access to a forge you can graft the magical powers of a weapon onto your signature weapon. This process destroys the magical weapon. Your signature weapon gains the magical powers of the destroyed weapon.
advanced_moves_1.name: Blacksmith

advanced_moves_2.description: When you deal damage, deal +1d8 damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Bloodthirsty

advanced_moves_2.description: When you choose to let your armor take the brunt of damage dealt to you, the damage is negated and you take +1 forward against the attacker, but you must reduce the armor value of your armor or shield (your choice) by 1. The value is reduced each time you make this choice. If the reduction leaves the item with 0 armor it is destroyed.
advanced_moves_2.name: Armored Perfection

advanced_moves_2.description: When you enter combat, roll+CHA. On a 10+, hold 2. On a 7-9, hold 1. Spend your hold to make eye contact with an NPC present, who freezes or flinches and can’t act until you break it off. On a 6-, your enemies immediately identify you as their biggest threat.
advanced_moves_2.name: Evil Eye

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Hack & Slash an enemy, your next attack against that same foe deals +1d8 damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Taste of Blood

advanced_moves_2.description: Get one move from another class. Treat your level as one lower for choosing the move.
advanced_moves_2.name: Multiclass Initiate

advanced_moves_2.description: You gain +2 armor.
advanced_moves_2.name: Steel Hide

advanced_moves_2.description: When you go into battle, roll+WIS. On a 10+, name someone who will live and someone who will die. On a 7-9, name someone who will live or someone who will die. Name NPCs, not player characters. The GM will make your vision come true, if it’s even remotely possible. On a 6- you see your own death and consequently take -1 ongoing throughout the battle.
advanced_moves_2.name: Through Death’s Eyes

advanced_moves_2.description: When you look over an enemy’s weaponry, ask the GM how much damage they do.
advanced_moves_2.name: Eye for Weaponry

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Hack & Slash on a 12+ you deal your damage, avoid their attack, and impress, dismay, or frighten your enemy.
advanced_moves_2.name: Superior Warrior

evil.name: Evil

bonds: __________ owes me their life, whether they admit it or not.
I have sworn to protect __________.
I worry about the ability of __________ to survive in the dungeon.
__________ is soft, but I will make them hard like me.
description:
It’s a thankless job—living day to day by your armor and the skill of your arm. To dive heedlessly into danger. They won’t be playing golden horns for the time you took that knife to the ribs for them in the bar in Bucksberg. No flock of angels to sing of the time you dragged them, still screaming, from the edge of the Pits of Madness, no.

Forget them.

You do this for the guts and the glory. The scream of battle and the hot, hot blood of it. You are a beast of iron. Your friends may carry blades of forged steel but, fighter, you are steel. While your traveling companions might moan about their wounds over a campfire in the wilderness, you bear your scars with pride.

You are the wall—let every danger smash itself to nothing on you. In the end, you’ll be the last one standing.

gear_choices.label: Choose two
list: Antitoxin (10 coins, 0 weight), dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight), and Poultices and Herbs (2 uses, slow, 10 coins, 1 weight)

name: Fighter

race_moves.description: When you share a drink with someone, you may Parley with them using CON instead of CHA.
race_moves.name: Dwarf

race_moves.description: Choose one weapon—you can always treat weapons of that type as if they had the precise tag.
race_moves.name: Elf

race_moves.description: When you Defy Danger and use your small size to your advantage, take +1.
race_moves.name: Halfling

race_moves.description: Once per battle you may reroll a single damage roll (yours or someone else’s).
race_moves.name: Human

starting_gear: You carry your signature weapon and dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight).

starting_moves.description:
When you use pure strength to destroy an inanimate obstacle, roll+Str. On a 10+, choose 3. On a 7-9 choose 2.

 - It doesn’t take a very long time
 - Nothing of value is damaged
 - It doesn’t make an inordinate amount of noise
 - You can fix the thing again without a lot of effort
starting_moves.name: Bend Bars, Lift Gates

starting_moves.description: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear.
starting_moves.name: Armored

starting_moves.description:
This is your weapon. There are many like it, but this one is yours. Your weapon is your best friend. It is your life. You master it as you master your life. Your weapon, without you, is useless. Without your weapon, you are useless. You must wield your weapon true.
Choose a base description, all are 2 weight:

 - Sword
 - Axe
 - Hammer
 - Spear
 - Flail
 - Fists
Choose the range that best fits your weapon:

 - Hand
 - Close
 - Reach
Choose two enhancements:

 - Hooks and spikes. +1 damage, but +1 weight.
 - Sharp. +2 piercing.
 - Perfectly weighted. Add precise.
 - Serrated edges. +1 damage.
 - Glows in the presence of one type of creature, your choice.
 - Huge. Add messy and forceful.
 - Versatile. Choose an additional range.
 - Well-crafted. -1 weight.
Choose a look:

 - Ancient
 - Unblemished
 - Ornate
 - Blood-stained
 - Sinister
starting_moves.name: Signature Weapon

advanced_moves_1.description: Dedicate yourself to a deity (name a new one or choose one that’s already been established). You gain the commune and cast a spell cleric moves. When you select this move, treat yourself as a cleric of level 1 for using spells. Every time you gain a level thereafter, increase your effective cleric level by 1.
advanced_moves_1.name: Divine Favor

advanced_moves_1.description: When you take damage you can grit your teeth and accept the blow. If you do you take no damage but instead suffer a debility of your choice. If you already have all six debilities you can’t use this move.
advanced_moves_1.name: Bloody Aegis

advanced_moves_1.description: While on a quest you deal +1d4 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Smite

advanced_moves_1.description: When you speak aloud your promise to defeat an enemy, you deal +2d4 damage against that enemy and -4 damage against anyone else. This effect lasts until the enemy is defeated. If you fail to defeat the enemy or give up the fight, you can admit your failure, but the effect continues until you find a way to redeem yourself.
advanced_moves_1.name: Exterminatus

advanced_moves_1.description: When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead take +1 forward.
advanced_moves_1.name: Charge!

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Defend you always get +1 hold, even on a 6-.
advanced_moves_1.name: Staunch Defender

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Hack & Slash, choose an ally. Their next attack against your target does +1d4 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Setup Strike

advanced_moves_1.description: You get +1 armor while on a quest.
advanced_moves_1.name: Holy Protection

advanced_moves_1.description: Take +1 to order hirelings.
advanced_moves_1.name: Voice of Authority

advanced_moves_1.description: When you heal an ally, you heal +1d8 damage.
advanced_moves_1.name: Hospitaller

advanced_moves_2.description: When you see divine magic as it happens, you can ask the GM which deity granted the spell and its effects. Take +1 when acting on the answers.
advanced_moves_2.name: Evidence of Faith

advanced_moves_2.description: While on a quest you deal +1d8 damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Holy Smite

advanced_moves_2.description: When you lead the charge into combat, those you lead take +1 forward and +2 armor forward.
advanced_moves_2.name: Ever Onward

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Defend you always get +1 hold, even on a 6-. When you get a 12+ to defend instead of getting hold the nearest attacking creature is stymied giving you a clear advantage, the GM will describe it.
advanced_moves_2.name: Impervious Defender

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Hack & Slash, choose an ally. Their next attack against your target does +1d4 damage and they take +1 forward against them.
advanced_moves_2.name: Tandem Strike

advanced_moves_2.description: You get +2 armor while on a quest.
advanced_moves_2.name: Divine Protection

advanced_moves_2.description: Take +1 to order hirelings. When you roll a 12+ the hireling transcends their moment of fear and doubt and carries out your order with particular effectiveness or efficiency.
advanced_moves_2.name: Divine Authority

advanced_moves_2.description: When you heal an ally, you heal +2d8 damage.
advanced_moves_2.name: Perfect Hospitaller

advanced_moves_2.description: When you suffer a debility (even through Bloody Aegis) take +1 forward against whatever caused it.
advanced_moves_2.name: Indomitable

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Quest you choose three boons instead of two.
advanced_moves_2.name: Perfect Knight

good.name: Good

lawful.description: Deny mercy to a criminal or unbeliever.
lawful.name: Lawful

bonds: __________’s misguided behavior endangers their very soul!
__________ has stood by me in battle and can be trusted completely.
I respect the beliefs of __________ but hope they will someday see the true way.
__________ is a brave soul, I have much to learn from them.
description:
Hell awaits. An eternity of torment in fire or ice or whatever best suits the sins of the damned throngs of Dungeon World. All that stands between the pits of that grim torture and salvation is you. Holy man, armored war machine, templar of the Good and the Light, right? The cleric may say his prayers at night to the gods, dwelling in their heavens. The fighter may wield his sharp sword in the name of “good” but you know. Only you.

Eyes, hands, and sweet killing blow of the gods, you are. Yours is the gift of righteousness and virtue. Of justice. Vision, too. A purity of intent that your companions do not have.

So guide these fools, paladin. Take up your holy cause and bring salvation to the wastrel world. 

Vae victis, right?

gear_choices.label: Choose one
list: Dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight) and Healing Potion (50 coins, 0 weight)

looks: Worn Holy Symbol Fancy Holy Symbol
name: Paladin

race_moves.description: When you pray for guidance, even for a moment, and ask, “What here is evil?” the GM will tell you, honestly.
race_moves.name: Human

starting_gear: You start with dungeon rations (ration, 5 uses, 3 coins, 1 weight), Scale Armor (2 armor, worn, 3 weight), and some mark of faith, describe it (0 weight).

starting_moves.description: When you touch someone, skin to skin, and pray for their well-being , roll+CHA. On a 10+ you heal 1d8 damage or remove one disease. On a 7–9, they are healed, but the damage or disease is transferred to you.
starting_moves.name: Lay on Hands

starting_moves.description: You ignore the clumsy tag on armor you wear.
starting_moves.name: Armored

starting_moves.description:
When you give an NPC an order based on your divine authority, roll+Cha. On a 7+, they choose one:

 - Do what you say
 - Back away cautiously, then flee
 - Attack you
On a 10+, you also take +1 forward against them. On a miss, they do as they please and you take -1 forward against them.
starting_moves.name: I Am the Law

starting_moves.description:
When you dedicate yourself to a mission through prayer and ritual cleansing, state what you set out to do:

 - Slay __________, a great blight on the land
 - Defend __________ from the iniquities that beset them
 - Discover the truth of __________
Then choose up to two boons:

 - An unwavering sense of direction to __________.
 - Invulnerability to __________ (e.g., edged weapons, fire, enchantment, etc.)
 - A mark of divine authority
 - Senses that pierce lies
 - A voice that transcends language
 - A freedom from hunger, thirst, and sleep
The GM will then tell you what vow or vows is required of you to maintain your blessing:

 - Honor (forbidden: cowardly tactics and tricks)
 - Temperance (forbidden: gluttony in food, drink, and pleasure of the flesh)
 - Piety (required: observance of daily holy services)
 - Valor (forbidden: suffering an evil creature to live)
 - Truth (forbidden: lies)
 - Hospitality (required: comfort to those in need, no matter who they are)
starting_moves.name: Quest

advanced_moves_1.description: Somewhere in your lineage lies mixed blood and it begins to show its presence. You gain the elf starting move if you took the human one at character creation or vice versa.
advanced_moves_1.name: Half-Elven

advanced_moves_1.description: You can speak with and understand animals.
advanced_moves_1.name: Wild Empathy

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Spout Lore about a monster you use WIS instead of INT.
advanced_moves_1.name: Familiar Prey

advanced_moves_1.description: When you strike an enemy with two weapons at once, add an extra 1d4 damage for your off-hand strike.
advanced_moves_1.name: Viper’s Strike

advanced_moves_1.description: When you keep still in natural surroundings, enemies never spot you until you make a movement.
advanced_moves_1.name: Camouflage

advanced_moves_1.description: When you allow your animal companion to take a blow that was meant for you, the damage is negated and your animal companion’s ferocity becomes 0. If its ferocity is already 0 you can’t use this ability. When you have a few hours of rest with your animal companion its ferocity returns to normal.
advanced_moves_1.name: Man’s Best Friend

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Volley you may spend extra ammo before rolling. For each point of ammo spent you may choose an extra target. Roll once and apply damage to all targets.
advanced_moves_1.name: Blot Out the Sun

advanced_moves_1.description: Choose another training for your animal companion.
advanced_moves_1.name: Well-Trained

advanced_moves_1.description: Dedicate yourself to a deity (name a new one or choose one that’s already been established). You gain the Commune and Cast a Spell cleric moves. When you select this move, treat yourself as a cleric of level 1 for using spells. Every time you gain a level thereafter, increase your effective cleric level by 1.
advanced_moves_1.name: God Amidst the Wastes

advanced_moves_1.description: When you Undertake a Perilous Journey you can take two roles. You make a separate roll for each.
advanced_moves_1.name: Follow Me

advanced_moves_1.description: When you set the watch for the night, everyone takes +1 to Take Watch.
advanced_moves_1.name: A Safe Place

advanced_moves_2.description: You can speak with and understand any non-magical, non-planar creature.
advanced_moves_2.name: Wild Speech

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Spout Lore about a monster you use WIS instead of INT. On a 12+, in addition to the normal effects, you get to ask the GM any one question about the subject.
advanced_moves_2.name: Hunter’s Prey

advanced_moves_2.description: When you strike an enemy with two weapons at once, add an extra 1d8 damage for your off-hand strike.
advanced_moves_2.name: Viper’s Fangs

advanced_moves_2.description: When you know your target’s weakest point your arrows have 2 piercing.
advanced_moves_2.name: Smaug’s Belly

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Undertake a Perilous Journey you can take two roles. Roll twice and use the better result for both roles.
advanced_moves_2.name: Strider

advanced_moves_2.description: When you set the watch for the night everyone takes +1 to Take Watch. After a night in camp when you set the watch everyone takes +1 forward.
advanced_moves_2.name: A Safer Place

advanced_moves_2.description: When you Hunt and Track, on a hit you may also ask one question about the creature you are tracking from the Discern Realities list for free.
advanced_moves_2.name: Observant

advanced_moves_2.description: Choose a move from another class. So long as you are working with your animal companion you have access to that move.
advanced_moves_2.name: Special Trick

advanced_moves_2.description: Your animal companion is a monster, not an animal. Describe it. Give it +2 ferocity and +1 instinct, plus a new training.
advanced_moves_2.name: Unnatural Ally

chaotic.name: Chaotic
